subject: Leadership
title: OKRs and Strategic Alignment
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: OKRs and Strategic Alignment.

hook.text: Google adopted OKRs when it had 40 employees. Today at 180,000, they still credit the framework for strategic focus.

buildup.text: OKRsâ€”Objectives and Key Resultsâ€”connect ambitious goals to measurable outcomes. They cascade from company to team level.

discovery.text: The magic is transparency: when everyone's OKRs are visible, alignment happens naturally and duplication disappears.

twist.text: OKRs fail when leaders set too many. The constraint is focus: 3-5 objectives per level, each with 2-4 key results.

climax.text: Leaders use OKRs to translate strategy into action, review quarterly, and keep the entire organization rowing together.

punchline.text: Strategy is nothing without execution. OKRs bridge the gap.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of OKRs?
options: To connect goals to measurable outcomes
